newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malakoff power plant stake buy approved.
newsitem.headline: Malakoff power plant stake buy approved.

text.p: Malaysia's Malakoff Bhd said on Wednesday its proposed acquisition of the entire paid-up capital of Hypergantic Sdn Bhd has been approved by the Foreign Investment Committee and the Securities Commission.

Malakoff will acquire Hypergantic, which owns a 20 percent stake in power plant operator Port Dickson Power Sdn Bhd, for 75 million ringgit to be satisfied by an issue of 9.375 million new Malakoff shares at 8.0 ringgit each, it said in a statement. Malakoff shares ended at 11.50 ringgit on Wednesday.

The Securities Commission has also granted a waiver to Malakoff and its parent company, Malaysian Resources Corp Bhd from the obligation to extend a mandatory general offer for the remaining shares in Port Dickson Power not already owned by them, the statement said.
Port Dickson Power owns and operates a 440 megawatt power plant in Port Dickson on the west coast of Peninsular Malaysia, supplying electricity exclusively to state power firm, Tenaga Nasional Bhd.
